title: Update site theme to classic blue, turquoise, and gold

requirements.text: Update the global theme color tokens to a classic palette of blue (primary), turquoise (secondary), and gold (accent) using the existing CSS variable (OKLCH) theme system so Tailwind/Shadcn theme utilities automatically inherit the new colors in both light and dark modes.
acceptanceCriteria: In both frontend/index.css and frontend/src/index.css, the CSS variables for --primary/--secondary/--accent (and their -foreground counterparts) are updated to reflect a classic blue, turquoise, and gold palette.
Light mode and dark mode remain readable (sufficient contrast between background/foreground and for buttons/links).
No Tailwind config changes are required beyond continuing to map colors to CSS variables as currently implemented.

requirements.text: Replace any hardcoded mint/emerald/green/gray/white color utilities in site sections and navigation with theme token-based classes (e.g., bg-background, text-foreground, text-primary, bg-secondary, text-accent-foreground, border-border) so the updated blue/turquoise/gold theme is applied consistently across the app.
acceptanceCriteria: Components that currently use hardcoded emerald/green styling (e.g., AdminPanelSection headings/buttons) are updated to use theme tokens instead of fixed Tailwind colors like text-emerald-700 or bg-emerald-600.
Nav bar, hero, forms, cards, and admin overlay all visually reflect the updated theme without leftover mint/emerald-specific colors.
The page background gradient continues to work with the new palette and does not clash with text readability.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only shadcn components); compose via props/classes from consuming components instead.
Do not modify immutable hook files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
nonGoals: No backend changes (Motoko actor logic/persistence) are required for this theme update.
Do not change app content, section structure, or add new features unrelated to theming.
